fields.Title of Contribution: “Model Reference Adaptive Control of Cardiac Output and Blood Pressure through Two Drug Infusions”
fields.Name of Conference: 5th IEEE International Symposium on Intelligent Control 1990
fields.Description/Abstract:
Control of blood pressure and cardiac output with
dopamine and sodium nitroprusside was achieved using a
model reference adaptive controller. A procedure for selecting
the adaptation weights for a 2x2 system was developed.
Satisfactory model following occurred despite time
delays that caused stability criteria to be violated. The
structure of the plant prohibited zero steady state error in
some cases, even if the parameters were known. However,
the resulting plant response was allowable from a physician’s
viewpoint. The adaptive controller was compared
to a nonadaptive controller, showing the motivation for
adaptive control.
